conversations.context: Two colleagues discussing a project deadline at the office.

dialogue.speaker: Man
dialogue.text: Hey Susan, have you finished the report for the Anderson project?

dialogue.speaker: Woman
dialogue.text: Not yet. I’m still waiting on the latest figures from the sales department.

dialogue.speaker: Man
dialogue.text: Oh, I thought they sent those out yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Woman
dialogue.text: Apparently there was a delay. They promised to send them by noon today.

questions.question: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
Why hasn't the report been completed?

choices.C: Sales figures have not been received
choices.D: The manager is out of office

questions.question: What is expected to happen by noon?

choices.C: The sales department will send data

conversations.context: A customer speaking with a hotel receptionist about a reservation.

dialogue.speaker: Woman
dialogue.text: Good afternoon, I have a reservation under the name Miller.

dialogue.speaker: Man
dialogue.text: Let me check... Yes, I see it here. One queen-size room for two nights.

dialogue.speaker: Woman
dialogue.text: That’s right, but I’d like to change it to a king-size if available.

dialogue.speaker: Man
dialogue.text: Let me see... Yes, we do have one available. There’s a small upgrade fee.

questions.question: Where is the conversation taking place?
What does the woman want to change?

choices.B: The type of bed in the room

questions.question: What does the man say about the change?
